TextView.android:text: M762 vs AKM PUBG, which AR gun is better? To answer this question, let’s do a brief comparison between these two powerful assault rie guns in PUBG Mobile. This article will compare these two weapons in some major and signicant criteria, such as damage, recoil, eective range, attachments, etc. Here we go!

M762 is also called Beryl in PUBG. Both AKM and Beryl use 7.62 ammo. In addition, these two guns are very powerful and eective in close combat and medium-range combat. Besides, players can use similar attachments for both Beryl and AKM, such as mag, scope, and muzzles. In addition, M762 and AKM have the same ammo speed of 715m/s. The eective ranges of these two weapons are similar (from 0-1000m).

Next, AKM and Beryl have the same number of bullets in an ammo load (30 without the mag and 40 with extended mag). Besides, the reloading speed of these two guns is also the same (2.9s without quickdraw mag, and 2.25s with a quickdraw mag). Moreover, the spawning rate of AKM and Beryl in all four maps of the game is not dierent. You can easily nd an AKM or a Beryl when landing on Miramar, Erangel, Sanhok, or Vikendi. If you are a fan of this shooting game, you will also know that AKM and Beryl M762 have great recoil. So, it requires excellent skills from PUBG players. These two guns are more dicult to control than the iconic AR gun: M416 in this game. Therefore, you need to make sure that you practice shooting with AKM and M762 well enough before engaging in any combat.

Damage per second (DPS) is another criterion to compare M762 and AKM. Although AKM has bigger damage, this AR gun has lower DPS than Beryl. The DPS of AKM is 490 while Beryl M762 causes 546 DPS. It’s because of the higher ring rate of the Beryl gun. Therefore, is the auto mode, M762 can be stronger than AKM of you can control it well and shoot correctly. But in a single ring mode, AKM is better. As mentioned in the rst criterion, Beryl M762 has a higher ring rate than AKM. The gap time between the rst and the second bullet of Beryl is 0.086s while in AKM, it takes 0.1s. It means that the ring rate of AKM is 600 bullets per minute. Meanwhile, Beryl’s ring rate is up to 698 bullets per minute. That’s also the reason why M762’s recoil is larger than AKM in auto mode. But in the single mode, AKM is more difficult to control.

Comparing M762 vs AKM PUBG in the ring mode, it seems that M762 surpasses AKM. There are only two ring modes in AKM, including single and auto. But Beryl M761 has another Burst ring mode beside Single and Auto as normal. In Burst Mode, the gun releases three bullets per shot. And the gap time between each bullet is 0.012s. In this criterion, Beryl M762 once again surpasses AKM when it has one more attachment slot than AKM. There are only three attachment slots in AKM, including mag, muzzle, and scope. Meanwhile, the Beryl M762 has four slots, including three slots like in the AKM and a slot for the grip. You are recommended to attach a vertical grip to this gun to reduce the recoil and control it better.

The iron sight of the AKM is easier to use than M762. It’s clearer with the less covered areas when you aim with the iron sight. But in Beryl M762, the covered area is pretty larger. So, if you cannot nd a scope or red dot to attach, you should use AKM for better aiming with an iron sight.
